meanings.definition: The act or instance of exploding.
meanings.sent1: The loud explosion startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display ended with a colorful explosion in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cake was such a hit that it caused an explosion of excitement at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an explosion of joy that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The explosion of confetti made the celebration even more festive.

meanings.definition: A violent expansion or bursting with noise.
meanings.sent1: The sudden explosion of the balloon made the children giggle.
meanings.sent2: The explosion of cheers erupted from the crowd when the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: The explosion of bubbles in the bath made bath time fun for the kids.
meanings.sent4: The news of her promotion caused an explosion of happiness in the office.
meanings.sent5: The explosion of colors in the painting caught everyone's attention.
